subject: Re: [junit] How to add functionality for execution flexibilty?
msgSnippet: ... Test groups maybe?  :-) @Test(groups = { unit , database }) public void testInsert() { ... } And then run the test methods in the group database but
messageBody:
On 8/9/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Michael,
>
> I agree that there is a gap currently in the API for extending JUnit's
> ability to run Java classes. We plan to revamp those classes for an
> upcoming 4.x release, and, for that reason, have discouraged clients
> from depending on the current implementation.
>
> Yours is a good use case to drive this API--could you post a feature
> request at SourceForge, so we can track it better?


Test groups maybe? :-)

@Test(groups = { "unit", "database" })
public void testInsert() { ... }

And then run the test methods in the group "database" but exclude the tests
in the group "slow".

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
